hero_dishes.name: Rogal ≈öwiƒôtomarci≈Ñski
hero_dishes.description: Crescent-shaped croissant with white poppy seed filling, nuts, raisins, and orange peel, glazed with icing
hero_dishes.origin_story: Created in 1891 to celebrate St. Martin's Day (November 11). Legend says a baker shaped it like a horseshoe from St. Martin's horse. Requires 81 layers and weighs 150-250g
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Rogalowe Muzeum Poznania (Croissant Museum with baking demonstrations), certified bakeries throughout Poznan

hero_dishes.name: Duck with Apples
hero_dishes.description: Roasted duck stuffed with apples and served with red cabbage and dumplings
hero_dishes.origin_story: A Greater Poland (Wielkopolska) specialty, traditionally served for celebrations and holidays
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Whiskey in the Jar, Brovaria, traditional Polish restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Szare Kluski
hero_dishes.description: Grey potato dumplings made with grated raw potatoes, served with meat sauce or bacon
hero_dishes.origin_story: A Wielkopolska peasant dish - the 'grey' color comes from oxidizing potatoes
